events.message: Customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection, causing significant damage.
The claim was reviewed and assigned to the Auto Accident cluster based on keywords found in the initial report.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the investigation and customer communication for this vehicle collision claim.
Customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been officially recognized and is under review.
Request sent to customer for submitting police reports, vehicle photos, and witness statements to proceed with claim processing.
Customer uploaded all requested documents, including the accident report, evidence photos, and repair estimates.
Investigation team began evaluating the circumstances around the vehicle collision, checking liability and damage extent.
The investigation was completed successfully; fault was determined and damages were thoroughly assessed.
A settlement package was proposed to the customer, outlining compensation for the repair costs and related expenses.
Customer responded with positive feedback about the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the claim handling.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company following customer acceptance of the settlement agreement.
Payment was processed and transferred to the customer’s account to cover the vehicle repair costs outlined in the settlement.
The claim was formally closed after successful payment issuance and confirmation that customer’s vehicle repairs were completed.
